channel.title: Azure Function on iAutomate
channel.description: Recent content in Azure Function on iAutomate

item.title: Failed SNAT Connections Detected in Azure PowerShell Function
item.description: Introduction I got stumbled with an issue, “Failed SNAT connections detected”. Luck favored! Yes, it’s a very minimal impact on the environment. However, I took remediation action as earliest as possible. The functions I have developed invokes Azure management API for a business reason. So, I ended up with the error due to the outbound connection. Microsoft recommends below For C# applications, ensure that the HttpClient object is created once and reused again.

item.title: Azure Event Grid Trigger Output Binding to Table Storage using PowerShell
item.description: Introduction Is it possible to write data to the storage table when the Azure Event Grid trigger is invoked? Yes, it is possible. A colleague requested to log the output of the Azure Functions transactions to the Azure table storage, and my call is to store only the required data. Indeed, cost and readability is the primary concern. With no further ado, let me walk you through the requirement. Challenge A colleague tried to implement and reached out to me with a challenge.
